description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use to include a rear dormer and conversion of roof from hip to gable end, erection of single storey extension to rear and erection of outbuilding to rear garden (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1(f)(i), Class A, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the proposed single storey rear extension would extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 3 metres.

The proposed  development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph B.1(d)(i), Class B, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the cubic content of the resulting roof space would exceed the cubic content of the original roof by more than 40 cubic metres.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph E.1(e)(ii), Class E, Part 1, Schedule 2, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the height of the proposed outbuilding would be within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse and exceed 2.5 metres in height.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph E.1(f), Class E, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the height of the eaves of the proposed outbuilding would exceed 2.5 metres.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Class E, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3, of the Town and Country Planning  (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because it has not been demonstrated, on the balance of probabilities, that the proposed outbuilding would be reasonably required for a purpose incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse at 311 Victoria Road, Ruislip.
